abstract: Defense lawyers for former Drug Enforcement Admin employees David Polos and Glen Glover say men's ownership of Twins Plus Go-Go Lounge in South Hackensack, NJ, was open secret at DEA, and that members of law enforcement even frequented strip club; Polos and Glover are accused of lying during national security background checks about their ownership of club.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers for the two men, who are charged with lying about the club during background checks, want permission to call other employees who may have visited the club.

headline.main: D.E.A. Workers’ Ownership of Strip Club Was an Open Secret, Lawyers Say
headline.print_headline: D.E.A. Workers’ Strip Club Wasn’t Secret, Lawyers Say

snippet: Lawyers for the two men, who are charged with lying about the club during background checks, want permission to call other employees who may have visited the club.

keywords.value: Twins Plus Go-Go Lounge (South Hackensack, NJ, Strip Club)
keywords.name: organizations
